intro: Monticalia abietina var. aciculata, commonly known as the fir-like monticalia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves that are densely packed, giving it a resemblance to fir trees. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often arranged in clusters. This variety is adapted to cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests.
